introduction: Tipsrundan 59 is here! We got a new blog, updated website and competence incoming!

godisboxen.title: Cypress JS Testing E2E
godisboxen.description: Are you doing front-end? Do you've any tips of E2E tests? We are currently looking for a good solution, and think Cypress will do. This is for a small Python Fullstack app.

godisboxen.title: AWS SageMaker Immersion Day
godisboxen.description: The analytics team had a AWS Immersion Day focusing on SageMaker and its capabilities. Daniel Odin and Maggie Tran did a quick write-up with differences compared to Azure **on our blog**!

godisboxen.description: Olle Johansson has taken a little time to make our buitsyd look nicer and the code look cleaner, find the updated look at buitsyd.com. Make sure to give Olle a thanks! ü§ó

godisboxen.title: Competence: Snowflake (teaser)
godisboxen.description:
Ever heard about Snowflake? Well we have.¬†¬†

For anyone that doesn‚Äôt know what it is here‚Äôs a TL;DR:

> - Democratize Data across your organization making it explorable
> - Share Data easily
> - Unify your data across solutions to easier comply with regulations such as GDPR
> - Connect locally or globally
> - Auto-scaling

  

Obviously this is from a sellers perspective, but we thought that we might as well dive into it and figure out what it is.¬†¬†  
More information will come, but for now all you need to know is that Snowflake is coming and anyone that‚Äôs willing will go through a core course.

godisboxen.title: Artikelcirkel: Docker (30/8)
godisboxen.description:
At the Analytics South team we ran a 'Artikelcirkel' where we usually go through blogs or papers, but this time it's a bit different. We'll explore Docker and what it is briefly.  
Interested? Reach out to Heidi Mach for an invite!

godisboxen.title: Why React Re-Renders
godisboxen.description:
I'll simply take an excerpt to get your interested!

So, I'll be honest. I had been working professionally with React¬†_for years_¬†without really understanding how React's re-rendering process worked. 😅  
I think this is true for lots of React developers. We understand enough to get by, but if you ask a group of React developers a question like¬†_‚ÄúWhat triggers a re-render in React?‚Äù_, you'll likely get a handful of different hand-wavy answers.
